intro: Irlbachia plantaginifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Irlbachia plantaginifolia is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
